intro: Hieracium oncodes, commonly known as the yellow hawkweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with basal leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy. Its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, and the plant produces numerous seeds that are dispersed by wind. Hieracium oncodes is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and it is considered a weed in some agricultural areas.
